text: What's up outliers? Quick general market update. Then I want to talk about P and W and then we'll take a look at GameStop. So let's get right into it. What happened today? Well, a slight down day, the first one that we've seen in a little while now for the SP 500 for the cues and for the Russell, it's still the weakest of the bunch by far. So I'm seeing a few things is you could tell the red volume, which is the sale volume is definitely ticking up here and we're still seeing volume contracting. So what's to be derived from that as per usual, don't know just yet, but it is kind of confirmation to me that this isn't necessarily a straight V-shape recovery from low to high. Does this mean that we start transacting sideways a little bit that would not surprise me at all. And it's because as you can tell for specifically the cues, we've just bumped into the point of control. A lot of people are wanting to transact there for something like the Russell, it just can't catch a big bit. It is struggling here. And we still have the SP 500 outperforming to the upside. So the other thing I notice from a broader perspective is the various premiums here have been contracting pretty meaningfully, interestingly enough for the 30 day vols in the SP 500, which I find curious, but it's not surprising with the VX being so suppressed

And it's just because I'm not really interested in going through the full cycle that I can present to you, which can be pretty nasty. Even recently it's gone from 85 down to 48. Just a big move and unfortunately there's no tax advantage for something like T-Triple Q's whereas if you're trading the indices themselves, which the NASDAQ index is super illiquid the option so I don't trade that. But the NASDAQ futures are kind of the next best choice there so that's probably what I will rotate into.
